metadata.Title: CVE-2017-3633 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent: Server: Memcached). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.36 and earlier and 5.7.18 and earlier. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via Memcached to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server as well as unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 6.5 (Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:H).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3633` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-common - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
percona-server-5.6 package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6 package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
